item.title: Fixed Income Analytics Associate
item.description:
What is the opportunity?

As a Fixed Income Analytics Associate, you will actively engage in market making activity in assigned asset classes. They provide Fixed Income system and technical support to all Fixed Income professionals. They provide business analysis, subject matter expertise, and application support for internally developed Fixed Income IT projects and externally developed vendor applications. They develop, enhance, and maintains tools and reporting capabilities.

 

What will you do?

  • Design, develop, and execute various trading strategies.
  • The incumbent is expected to be fully conversant and knowledgeable of market conditions and industry changes.
  • Build strong relationships with other internal trading desks and complement their trading activity.
  • Design, develop, analyze, recommend, and implement new tools to satisfy business needs.
  • Provide ongoing maintenance and enhancements of existing tools and reports.
  • Identify, develop, and maintain new and existing reporting capabilities to support and grow the business.
  • Work with internal RBC partners and external vendors to implement new products & services to the RBC Fixed Income platform.
  • Support daily activity of fixed income professionals by answering questions, provide training, resolve computer issues, troubleshoot and document system issues, communicate system changes and enhancements, and create & maintain documentation.
  • Support vendor applications including Tradeweb Direct, Bloomberg, TMC, Knight BondPoint, Lumesis, DPC Data, CreditSights and others.
     

What do you need to succeed?

Must-have

  • Bachelor’s Degree is required, preferably with a concentration in Business, Finance, Economics, or Computer Science
  • Ability to obtain Series 7 & 63 within 6 months of employment
  • 2+ years of progressive technical, analytical, or project experience, preferably in the financial services industry

 

Nice-to-have

  • Working knowledge of fixed income securities and products, trading characteristics and approaches, price influencing factors, and product area (including market liquidity, volatility, and pricing)
  • Experience programming with one or more programming languages
  • Experience with Microsoft Excel, Access, SQL Server, VBA, Python
  • Strong SQL writing and risk management skills
  • Experience in Fixed Income technology systems (Bloomberg, Tradeweb, TMC, Knight BondPoint, etc.

 

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • Client First: We will always earn the right to be our clients’ first choice
  • Collaboration: We win as One RBC
  • Accountability: We take ownership for personal and collective high performance
  • Diversity & Inclusion: We embrace diversity for innovation and growth
  • Integrity: We hold ourselves to the highest standards to build trust
     
    WMUS2022

 

 

RBC requires as a condition of employment that all successful candidates in the United States and Canada be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 prior to their start date, and may require proof of the same. Reasonable accommodation is available where required by law.

item.title: Manager, Performance Analytics and Reporting
item.description:
What is the opportunity?

In alignment with RBC’s collective ambition to “Win as One RBC”, the role of the Manager, Performance Analytics and Reporting supports the Director – Regional Support & Executive Dashboards, and Distribution Analytics team in their ability to execute P&CB Regional Banking strategy and drive achievement of in-year objectives.

 

The Distribution Analytics team collaborates with product/channel groups, Regional Banking leaders and teams across Canadian Banking National Office to help drive business results by providing relevant and timely reporting and analysis supporting both Retail and Business areas. You will work directly with Regional Banking leadership to develop, design, implement and manage Executive reporting that support strategic priorities. In addition, you will also help guide and shape strategic choices across the Regional Banking reporting and analytic ecosystem, deliver ad-hoc analytics, and be a subject matter data expert.

 

What will you do?

  • Drive business results by the design, development and production of insightful Executive reporting that aligns with, and supports Regional Banking strategic priorities. Leverage financial acumen to synthesizes and distil key information to enable faster Senior Management decision making and assists in establishment of action plans to maximize business performance.
  • As a subject matter expert, provides expert support and analyses around ADHOC deep dive requests resulting from Regional and Executive enquiries. Sourcing relevant data, performing in-depth analysis and presenting actionable insights to stakeholders in a timely and effective manner.
  • Deliver complete, accurate and timely Executive Regional Banking reporting by channel, role, product, and region that enable the business to meet their short and long term goals.
  • Interact with senior business and regional leadership to understand business and Regional Banking objectives, in order to continue to evolve and maximize effectiveness and align reporting and analytics to meet those objectives.
  • Investigate industry trends and organization knowledge to provide alternative reporting approaches/solutions that will drive performance to improve Regional Banking analytics across role, channel, product and region.
  • Review and leverages internal and external data/information to provide insights and context around impactful/actionable/controllable business performance opportunities;

 

What do you need to succeed?

Must have:

  • Strong business and financial acumen with proven analytical, communication and presentation skills;
  • Experience in financial services industry with broad understanding of retail and commercial roles, incentive, sales, distribution, and finance
  • Proven, superior, technical experience with very large data sets from multiple sources
  • Excellent technical skills in Tableau, Excel, and PowerPoint,
  • A self-starter with attention to detail and is highly organized
  • Analytical thinking – creative, innovative and strategic thinking, ability to conceptualize requirements, and strong problem solving required

 

Nice to have:

  • Familiar with a range of statistical data tools - strong data profiling, cleaning, and mining. (SAS, SQL, Python, R) preferred but not required.

 

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.  We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact
  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
  • Opportunities to do challenging work

 

 

RBC is committed to supporting flexible work arrangements when and where available. Details to be discussed with Hiring Manager.

item.title: Associate Director, Market Risk Analytics
item.description:
What is the opportunity?

Group Risk Management (GRM) provides independent and effective on-site monitoring, controlling, and reporting on the nature and extent of all material market risk on the RBC London Trading Floor – ensuring implementation of and compliance with risk management policies and procedures.

We are looking for someone to manage the development and strategic rollout of the reporting infrastructure for Structured Rates and Global Equities businesses. The incumbent will have strong problem solving, analytical and communication skills – and a track-record of delivering infrastructure changes by devising solutions and liaising with key stakeholders towards project completion.

You will have previous coding experience in Python, VBA, and SQL. You will be able to write tactical scripts where needed, whilst working with key stakeholders to drive strategic change. Hands on experience with Tableau (or similar) is required and  should ideally have a basic understanding of financial products and the main risk factors within the interest rate and equity businesses.  

 

What will you do?

  • Develop indepth knowledge of the current and strategic reporting infrastructure state
  • Propose, build, and develop tactical and strategic enhancements to the reporting infrastructure
  • Repurpose and rebuild the existing VBA-based reports to the strategic model/infrastructure
  • Enhance Tableau-based reports, and optimise existing reports
  • Co-ordinate project plans, and work with key IT and Risk Management stakeholders to drive deliverables to completion
  • Automate various daily tasks involved in the current reporting infrastructure, including implementation of control frameworks and best-practise checks
  • Provide support to the Risk Managers on day to day running of risk reports
  • Regularly update and clearly communicate progress and milestones with GRM management/users

 

 

What do you need to succeed?

 Must-have

  • Strong leadership skills and vision ; proven record of leading a team/project and delivering value-added results
  • Hands on experience working on large datasets and databases
  • Ability to understand and clearly communicated around highly complicated reporting infrastructure dependencies related to books of complex derivatives portfolios
  • Proficient in VBA/Python/SQL
  • Hands-on experience of Tableau
  • Excellent written and oral communication skills ; is able to articulate ideas, thought processes, and recommendations confidently and rationally to senior audiences
  • Relevant experience working with Group Risk Management/Trading at a top-tier financial company
  • Good understanding of the day-to-day responsibilities of Market Risk, and daily risk reporting
  • Preferable knowledge of derivatives and greeks for interest rate and equity option products, Stress testing and scenario analysis and value-at-Risk measurement

 

What is in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best - progressive thinking to keep growing and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper.  We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses, flexible benefits and competitive compensation
  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities
  • Opportunities to work with the best in the field
  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact
  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
  • A world-class training program in financial services
  • Flexible working options fully supported.

 

 

 

About RBC
Royal Bank of Canada is Canada’s largest bank, and one of the largest banks in the world, based on market capitalization. We are one of North America’s leading diversified financial services companies, and provide personal and commercial banking, wealth management, insurance, investor services and capital markets products and services on a global basis. We have over 80,000 full- and part-time employees who serve more than 16 million personal, business, public sector and institutional clients through offices in Canada, the U.S. and 37 other countries. For more information, please visit rbc.com.

 

Inclusion and Equal Opportunity Employment
RBC is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion. We are pleased to consider all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, protected veterans status, Aboriginal/Native American status or any other legally-protected factors. Disability-related accommodations during the application process are available upon request.

item.title: Senior Manager, Capacity Insights and Analytics
item.description:
What is the opportunity?

The analytics and insights expert within Capacity Optimization – Retail Banking: this business-centric role is to derive actionable insights using a broad range of RBC data on evolving client preferences and advisor behaviors to inform (i) approach to optimizing advisor placement to be in our clients’ paths (ii) business decisions on strategic initiatives to retain, grow, or accelerate market share.  In this role, you will be responsible for developing models, insights and strategies informed through statistical analyses on external data, internal RBC data and big data where relevant to enable business objectives.

 

What will you do?

  • Lead all complex analyses on clients, products, advisors, and leaders: end-to-end from designing analytical framework, sourcing/transforming data, performing analysis to deriving insights, preparing and presenting findings.
  • Collaborate with key partners in data, reporting, and analytics (e.g. DNA, SSE, CIDM, DABI, CXDI, LoB) to align on data sources and metric definitions, ensuring a One RBC view of our clients, portfolios, and sales power, and promoting credibility of the data-driven insights that influence business decisions.
  • Provide subject matter expertise to Capacity Optimization and Regional Banking at large with insights on emerging trends around client preferences and advisor behaviors to enable model assumptions calibration.
  • Collaborate with key partners in data management to ensure data integrity and completeness of data capture.
  • Apply statistical techniques such as clustering, predictive analytics and regression to population data for key insights.
  • Leverage big data skills to manage and transform multiple externally-sourced data for integration into opportunity and segmentation dashboards and models.
  • Maintain full professional knowledge of techniques and developments in Machine Learning and share knowledge with business partners and senior management.
  • Lead and/or represent Capacity Optimization in Regional Banking strategic initiatives (can range from customer relationship management to natural communities, from market structures to workforce planning).
  • Educate Capacity Optimization team and key stakeholders on analytics best practices and statistical methodologies.

 

What do you need to succeed?

Must have:

  • 7+ years of proven experience developing insights, frameworks and models including capacity optimization while meeting service, sales revenue, productivity and client experience expectations preferably in financial services environment
  • Strong quantitative skills with an advanced degree in one or more of the following: applied statistics/mathematics, business analytics
  • Proficiency in SAS/SQL, Python, Tableau
  • Extensive hands-on experience with RBC DWE and EDL, preferably with Retail Banking portfolio
  • Proven strong performance, and deemed a trusted partner, in analytical environments
  • Demonstrated ability in packaging and presenting insights to a broad range of stakeholders and executives
  • Strong communication and analytical skills
  • Well organized with strong impact and influence skills
  • Ability to collaborate and co-ordinate with other analytical teams across the enterprise

 

Nice to have:

  • Specialization in clustering analysis
  • Exposure to geodemographic segmentation
  • Experience in Call Centre, Retail Sales and/or Operations environment

 

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact
  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
  • Opportunities to do challenging work

 

 

 

RBC is committed to supporting flexible work arrangements when and where available. Details to be discussed with Hiring Manager.

 

RBC requires as a condition of employment that all successful candidates in the United States and Canada be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 prior to their start date, and may require proof of the same. Reasonable accommodation is available where required by law.

item.title: C++ Developer - Analytics Integration Services
item.description:
What is the opportunity?

As an Analytics Developer, you will develop our analytics infrastructure to make it more flexible, reliable, and performant. This role requires cooperation, coordination with quant, trading, and IT groups. You possess strong programming and API design skills.

Previous projects with low latency or high throughput analytics, and interest in financial products across asset classes would be preferred, but isn’t necessary.

 

What will you do?

  • Refactor and consolidate analytics-related functionality.
  • Design robust API’s around common pieces of functionality, refactoring the code to support these new APIs, retire legacy code, and ensure that structural problems are also addressed during the refactoring.
  • Investigate and fix stability problems, determine what the fundamental solution should be, and prioritize accordingly.
  • Identify and address gaps in test coverage.
  • Interface with vendor systems, expose analytics to Excel and Risk systems.
  • Proposes the design and implementation of strategic analytics API’s.
  • Analyse and fix performance and stability problems in the internal analytics layers.

 

What do you need to succeed?

 

Must Have:

  • Strong command of C++, Python or Java.
  • Expert in algorithms and data structures, object orientation, design patterns, and functional programming paradigms.
  • Excellent problem solving and quantitative skills.
  • Excellent API design, refactoring, profiling and code optimization skills.
  • Experience as a senior developer or team lead.

 

Nice to have:

  • Expertise with designing and supporting financial analytics API’s.
  • Experience with databases, distributed cache products, distributed and multithreaded computation, big data processing technologies such as Spark.
  • Experience with multiple platforms (Windows, Linux), compilers and tools for C++ development.
  • Experience with .Net.
  • Experience with build/test/release infrastructure.

 

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

item.title: Manager, Best Practice and Integration Analytics
item.description:
What is the opportunity?

In this role, you will be responsible for managing the day to day production jobs that support the daily Marketing Initiatives for the Customer Interaction & Decision Management (CIDM) team.  In addition you will provide ongoing support to CIDM Infrastructure and data transformation initiatives.  This role is focused on support, development and implementation of best practices.

 

What will you do?

  • Implement automated processes to operate in the CIDM environment as well as organizing and participating in walkthrough reviews of all computer processes being implemented and developed.
  • Schedule and monitor computer processing tasks, carefully following instructions and standard protocol
  • Review existing computer programs for adherence to coding standards. Make coding changes as necessary (SAS, SQL, Python) to bring the code up to standard.
  • Ensure that all CRM concepts and best practices are implemented in day to day routines, meeting business needs by performing quality assurance audits to ensure changes have been accurately interpreted in the build and meet the business objectives.
  • Follows all Data Stewardship and Governance policies and processes that align to and support Canadian Banking business strategies and priorities
  • Support infrastructure changes and deployment for CIDM environment.
  • Demonstrated relationship building including the ability to effectively manage to deadline
  • Teamwork, peer/partner collaboration and information sharing

 

What do you need to succeed?

Must-have

  • 2+ years specialty expertise in relationship database marketing and structured programming concepts, including the use of analytical tools (i.e. Python, SAS, UNIX, Tableau etc.)
  • Hands-on proficient experience with SAS, SQL, data warehouse, Python, R, and Scala is an asset.
  • Strong Quality Assurance experience including experience with campaign build and execution
  • Demonstrated reliability and ability to adapt quickly to emerging technology (i.e. Data Lakes)
  • Ability to work independently when required, while also able to follow instructions
  • Analytical thinker with good problem solving skills

 

Nice-to-have

  • Degree or diploma in Information Technology, Computer Science or related field
  • Prior experience in the financial services industry and direct marketing would be an asset

 

What’s in it for you?

item.title: AD -Senior Quant Dev - Analytics Integration
item.description:
What is the opportunity?

 

This front-office-facing role within Quantitative and Technology Services (QTS) consists of developing applications for the Structured Rates, Flow, and Credits desks within the RAMPP (Risk, Analytics, Modelling, Pricing & Processing) organization.

You will be working closely with the business to create innovative and high-quality technology solutions to support business growth and innovation.

 

This is an opportunity to work closely with highly-engaged clients on the client and server-based pricing technologies. This London-based position requires candidates to possess excellent communication, organizational, and leadership skills and deal with trading/quant and support groups on a frequent basis.

 

What will you do?

 

  • Hands-on Development Lead in the Analytics Integration Services (AIS) team, leading a team of developers working on C++ and Python-based trading tools used by these desks.
  • Collaborate and facilitate decision-making with stakeholders. (Trading and Quants)
  • Collaborate and lead other developers to develop code in line with strategic FIC IT architecture. 
  • Provide second-level technical support.
  • Ability to turn business requirements into effective and robust solutions.
  • Develops the FX Options platform in partnership with teams in London, Toronto, and Krakow
  • Leads on key design and implementation decisions for the AIS platform
  • Manage and mentor a team of talented C++ / python developers

 

What do you need to succeed?

 

Must-have:

  • Strong C++ 14/17 development skills on Linux or Windows
  • Experience with TDD and test automation
  • Experience with Python
  • Good knowledge of continuous integration systems such as Jenkins, and version control systems such as Git
  • Knowledge of messaging and communication protocols such as TCP/IP and data serialization
  • Strong focus on delivering working software to production
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills to be able to work in a globally distributed team of both colleagues and business stakeholders
  • Excellent attention to detail & strong code review skills
  • Experience leading a development team

 

Nice-to-have:

  • Bachelor\'s Degree or equivalent
  • Experience interacting with front office users and external vendors
  • Knowledge of Interest Rate and/or Credit derivatives

 

What’s in it for you?

 

We thrive on the challenge to be our best - progressive thinking to keep growing and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper.  We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

item.title: Associate Director, IFRS 9 Execution & Analytics
item.description:
What is the opportunity?

 

Reporting to the Director, you will assist the business engagement, analytics and reporting of RBC’s IFRS 9 credit provisioning for specific portfolios. Additionally, you will manage the maintenance and development of requisite processes, SOX controls, and analyses in support of credit provisioning activities.

 

What will you do?

 

  • Understand and analyze portfolios results from IFRS9 expected credit loss models
  • Prepare reporting and provide communication to functional stakeholders on portfolios’ analysis and results
  • Assist with preparing reports and analyses for the Allowance Committee and senior executives, explaining/correlating reported expected credit loss (ECL) with macroeconomic and portfolio loss drivers.
  • Work with the Credit Measurement System team to understand credit provision results and assumptions
  • Work with the Credit Methodology and Modelling team to understand modelling assumptions and impact of ongoing methodology enhancement
  • Enhance the reporting framework by creating more tailored reports for specific stakeholders and improving current processes
  • Assist with preparing documentation of processes and policies including SOX controls as required
  • Keep abreast of macroeconomic, regulatory, accounting and other financial industry developments as they relate to RBC\'s credit provisioning.

 

What do you need to succeed?

Must Have:

 

  • Strong banking and risk knowledge (wholesale or retail credit or both), with cross-functional capability Risk and Finance
  • University degree preferred in an analytical discipline such as Finance, Statistics, Mathematics, or Economics
  • Experience in SAS/R/Python/MATLAB or other mathematical / statistical programming languages
  • Strong ability to communicate, verbally and in writing, complex concepts in non-technical terms to business segment and Finance
  • Quick learner with outstanding analytical, and problem solving skills, with an ability to work towards challenging deadlines and deliver under pressure

 

Nice to Have:

 

  • A thorough understanding of relevant accounting and regulatory rules and requirements (IFRS 9, Basel) preferred

 

What’s in it for you?

 

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

 

  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities
  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact
  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
  • Flexible work/life balance options
  • Opportunities to take on progressively greater accountabilities

item.title: Senior Product Manager, Public Cloud Data & Analytics
item.description:
Sr. Product Manager – Public Cloud Data & Analytics

 

What is the opportunity?

This is an exciting opportunity to shape the Cloud Platform at RBC, building on leading-edge technologies, cloud-native development and innovative data services. As a Product Manager, you will be part of a product-focused Azure and AWS Cloud platform team, working with our user community across the enterprise to anticipate and define platform needs and features and gain feedback, as we build exciting new features in the cloud computing world.

What will you do?

  • Contribute to the development of roadmaps for the services, researching industry trends, best practices
  • Perform needs analysis by working with the user community across applications developers, database administrators, infrastructure engineers, data scientists and data engineers to understand their needs.
  • Become the subject matter expert for the platform and customer experience
  • Work with the engineering team to develop capabilities and be the voice of the customer
  • Identify incremental steps to deliver a product vision and work closely with the engineering team to deliver the implementation.
  • Help provide product support to the user community either by directly responding to inquiries or developing support material
  • Participate in discussions with technology vendors
  • Collaborate with the Program Operations team and other Product Managers to develop content for communications and reporting

 

What do you need to succeed? Must-have

  • Excellent technical understanding of public and private cloud technologies
  • Experience in Cloud Data & Analytics Solutions would be an asset
  • Understanding of cloud-native architectures
  • Knowledge of CI/CD tooling, Kubernetes, IaC approach in provisioning and managing IT infrastructure
  • Knowledge of big data and analytics technologies would be an asset
  • Outstanding communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to simplify complex information and illustrate the business value we provide to our stakeholders
  • Experience in working directly with senior stakeholders and executives
  • Commitment to learn, especially on technical details of technologies
  • Ability to understand business needs and propose viable solutions that address them, regardless of whether or not the solutions are technical in nature
  • Familiar with common agile development methodologies like Scrum and Kanban

 

Nice-to-have

  • Agile Product Owner or Product Management experience
  • Working experience in working in a technology or banking-related field
  • Experience building cloud native applications or previous software development experience
  • Hands-on experience with JIRA, Confluence, Mural and/or Lucidchart
  • Experience with public cloud platforms such as Azure, AWS and Google Cloud Platform
  • Experience with automation tools such as Terraform and Ansible

 

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge of designing the best cloud platform and enabling our developers to be extremely productive. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation, commissions, and stock where applicable
  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities
  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact
  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
  • A world-class training program in financial services
  • Flexible work/life balance options
  • Opportunities to do challenging work
  • Opportunities to take on progressively greater accountabilities

item.title: Associate, Institutional Client Credit Management - Portfolio Management & Analytics
item.description:
What is the opportunity?

RBC’s Institutional Client Credit Management Team is looking for an Associate to deliver analysis, insights and recommendations on risk profiles that are meaningful and timely with respect to bank and sovereign counterparties. In addition the Associate will support business units to fulfil specific targets and objectives through the application of disciplined risk management processes.

 

What will you do?

  • Risk identification and assessment (60%):
    • Collaborate with Group Risk Management (GRM) to maintain quality and the right balance of risk and reward within the portfolio including preparation of: Risk assessment reviews (RAFs), supporting documentation and forward looking assessments 
    • Participate in continuous monitoring of counterparty and portfolio risks and make recommendations to ensure consistent application of policies and guidelines, operational risks/controls deficiencies are identified and reported and appropriate sizing of trading and non-trading limits and tenor 
  • Transaction support (30%):
    • Participate in the First line of Defence by assisting with mantainence of appropriate client risk levels within assigned portfolio
    • Partner with business units including ICCM - Transaction Management to complete regulatory reviews and help ensure relationship remains within RBC policy and risk appetite
  • Portfolio Management (10%):
    • Interact with business units to provide information on assigned names within the portfolio including data and analysis on limits and utilization
    • Contribute to the production of portfolio statistics and management information reports in a timely and accurate manner. This includes ad hoc and regularly scheduled quarterly reporting, country exposure updates, peer reviews, stress testing etc.

 

What do you need to succeed?

Must-have:

  • A completed Undergraduate Degree in Business, Finance, Accounting or a related quantitative field.
  • Strong Excel skills and experience working with large data sets.
  • At least 3 years of experience working within the Financial Services sector, preferably in risk management 
  • Strong analytical, research and problem-solving skills
  • Working knowledge of trading products including derivatives and securities finance and non-trading product offerings supporting cash management, operations and trade finance.
  • Working knowledge of the C.A.M.E.L.S. - approach to credit risk assessment 
  • Proactive and self-motivated with strong organizational and time management skills
  • Good verbal and written communication skills

 

Nice-to-have:

  • Work experience in a Back Office or Middle Office is considered an asset
  • Post graduate degree (MBA, MA) in Finance or Economics
  • Successfully acquired a FRM, CFA or CPA designation 

 

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, with progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits plus competitive compensation.
  • Opportunities to do challenging work and learn about products, credit, and risk ratings.
  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team.
  • Opportunity to interact with different internal groups and build a comprehensive network.
  • Opportunities to take on progressively greater accountabilities.

 

 

RBC requires as a condition of employment that all successful candidates in the United States and Canada be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 prior to their start date, and may require proof of the same.  Reasonable accommodation is available where required by law.

item.title: Data Analyst
item.description:
What is the opportunity?

RBC Bank is hiring a Data Analyst based out of Raleigh, NC. As the Data Analyst, you will be responsible for identifying trends, developing insights and making recommendations for Risk Management or the line of business.  In addition, you will bring digital knowledge together to deliver insightful reporting and ad hoc analytics.

 

What will you do?  

  • Enhances MIS environment to support active portfolio management which includes, but is not limited to: Loss Forecasting, Consumer ALLL, Policy Exception reporting, performance tracking, and Vintage analysis. Add industry and business intelligence to supplement data.
  • Responsible for providing reporting, statistical trends and analysis for Risk Management, Finance and/or the business
  • Provides oversight for the Bank’s loss mitigation and collections activities and ensure appropriate Non-Accrual, TDR, loss recognition loss recognition in accordance with Regulatory guidance and policy.
  • Works closely with Management to support Risk Management and/or business strategy through insights derived from analytics and reporting
  • Identifies performance trends and recommends initiatives to address weaknesses and leverage opportunities
  • Executes deep dive analytics for areas within the dashboard or daily results relative to plan, forecast or targets
  • Supports  the “story-telling” to ensure insights are delivered in a meaningful and relevant manner to key partners and stakeholders
  • Promotes analytics across the enterprise to enable RBC to become a data-driven organization.

 

What do you need to succeed?

Basic Qualifications

  • Bachelors in Mathematics, Statistics, Machine Learning or Computer Science
  • 2+ years of relevant progressive analytics experience, preferably within the financial industry and/or relevant line of business
  • Experience in Risk Management (ALLL), Product, Business Intelligence, and/or Marketing data analytics and mining.
  • Deep data mining and technical skills and experience translating data into consumable messages.
  • Superior and proven experience in the application of experimental design and statistical analysis of results coupled with strong understanding of technical skills in SAS, SQL, or Teradata.

 

Suggested Qualifications:

  • Experience in financial services industry with broad understanding of marketing, product management, sales, finance, pricing and risk management is preferred
  • Masters in Mathematics, Statistics, Machine Learning or Computer Science

  

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, fair compensation, commissions, and stock where applicable
  • Leaders who help your development through coaching and managing opportunities
  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact
  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team

 

RBCBank

Royal Bank of Canada is Canada’s largest bank, and one of the largest banks in the world, based on market capitalization. We have over 80,000 full- and part-time employees who serve more than 16 million personal, business, public sector and institutional clients through offices in Canada, the U.S. and 37 other countries. item.title: Internal Audit Director, Risk Management Compliance
item.description:
What is the opportunity?

As our new Internal Audit Director, Risk Management Compliance, you will support RBC Bank Internal Audit in providing independent, objective assurance over the design and operation of the Bank’s risk management practices, Regulatory Compliance including AML/BSA, governance processes and the system of internal controls. You will also provide support in responding to external auditors and US regulators to meet the evolving demands of the US regulatory environment and heightened expectations of internal audit.

 

What will you do?

  • Key responsibility to oversee/manage audit engagements and projects with a focus on risk management practices and regulatory compliance including AML/BSA compliance

  • Implement and maintain an IA approach to ensure Heightened Standards Risk Governance framework requirements are met across the 3 lines of defence.

  • Direct oversight of the audit universe for Compliance, AML, Risk Management and other support functions.

  • Work with efficiency and effectiveness, maintaining Internal Audit methodology and standards, in the planning, execution and reporting of deliverables.

  • Responsible for delivering key insights to management and supporting functions. Leveraging deep expertise in business strategy to support the audit function and the organization with actionable insights to drive ongoing success.

  • Supports the continuous improvement of audit methodologies, audit approach and related practices with particular emphasis towards collaboration with key partners, leveraging the use of analytics, business intelligence, and other enabling approaches, technologies and tools. 

  • Direct, counsel, and manage a staff of internal auditors assigned to engagements and review audit plan, findings, and reports for sufficient scope, accuracy, appropriateness of conclusions and compliance with requirements.

  • Coordinate and manage regulatory requests and examinations with bank regulators and external auditor.

 

What do you need to succeed?

Must-have
Leadership and People Management experience:

  • Demonstrate successful build of inclusive and diverse teams or committees.

  • Demonstrated experience in working in a matrixed organization with proven ability to multitask and prioritize activities.

  • Experience leading, coaching and mentoring direct reports
                                   
    Audit and Assurance experience

  • Business experience in a financial institution or technology company, dealing with multiple business platforms, business processes, geographies, and legal entities, as evidenced by 7-10 years relevant experience.

  • Audit experience with some leadership, as evidenced by 7-10 years relevant experience.

  • Risk Management experience including any one of operational risk, credit risk, ERM/corporate governance, etc., in either 1st or 2nd line of defense

  • Strong understanding of regulatory compliance risk including AML/BSA compliance across 1st and 2nd lines of defense

  • Experience working with external US and Canadian regulators such as OCC, Federal Reserve, OSFI
     

Relationship building and client experience:

  • Has consistently recommended and implement innovative solutions to improve inefficient processes

  • Strong relationship management skills           

 

Data Analytics and Technology experience:

  • Strong experience in use of data analytics, visualization and reporting – e.g. Tableau.

  • Experience planning integrated business audits with technology auditors.

  • Understanding of core technology (applications and infrastructure).

  • Experience in data analytics (data gathering, transformation, analytics, and reporting)

 

Nice-to-have

  • Professional Designation (CIA, CPA, CISA, CISSP, CISM)  

  • Analytical thinking skills-ability to develop dashboards and reports across various tools (i.e. Tableau)

  • Knowledge of how current trends and technology may be used to support business partners

  • Proficient understanding of and ability to identify how technology solves business problems

 

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, fair compensation, commissions, and stock where applicable

  • Leaders who help your development through coaching and managing opportunities

  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact

  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team

item.title: Senior Data Scientist
item.description:
What is the opportunity?  

In this role as a Senior Data Scientist, you will analyze, design, and implement data science/machine learning solutions using RBC’s enterprise suite of analytics tools.  The group specializes in taking full advantage of large data sets to explore and discover new insights that would have not been possible with traditional analytics.  Leveraging leading-edge technologies and capabilities, the group applies machine learning and statistical modeling techniques to help RBC understand the changing business environment, discover new growth opportunities and determine where business improvements can be made.       

 

What will you do?

  • Collaborate with key business partners and stakeholders to understand business objectives/opportunities and problem statements in order to provide solutions that align to business needs that are actionable with a tangible outcome
  • Prepare and transform data (structured/non-structured)
  • Develop and deploy ML solutions at scale
  • Prepare, integrate large and varied datasets and implement statistical and ML models using Python and R.
  • Leverage visualization tools/packages to story-tell and to convey data-driven insights with actionable recommendations to key stakeholders
  • Quickly learn new methods, tools and technologies presented in research communities to implement, adapt and innovate
  • Effectively communicate findings to business partners and executives.

 

 

What do you need to succeed?

 

Must-have  

  • Bachelors or Master’s degree in Engineering, Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Economics, Sociology or Psychology.
  • 5+ years of experience in data solutions and applying data techniques.
  • Strong knowledge of design, development, and implementation experience utilizing data science technologies.
  • 3+ years of experience in machine learning, predictive analytics, and statistical modeling. Familiar with programing and scripting languages Python, R, Java and SQL.
  • Excellent analytical, problem solving, time management and organizational skills.

 

 

Nice to have:

  • Familiar with a range of data tools.
  • Experience in programming, scripting languages and data visualization.
  • Familiar with a Linux environment and shell scripting.
  • Familiar with data extract, transform, and load processes with a variety of data types.

 

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation, commissions, and stock where applicable
  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities
  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact
  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
  • A world-class training program in financial services
  • Flexible work/life balance options
  • Opportunities to do challenging work

 

 

RBC requires as a condition of employment that all successful candidates in the United States and Canada be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 prior to their start date, and may require proof of the same.  Reasonable accommodation is available where required by law.

item.title: Senior Analyst, Workday Reporting
item.description:
What is the opportunity?

 

It\'s always great to be a part of an exciting team!

 

This role balances business acumen and technical skills to deliver best in class curating HR reporting and insights within Workday.

 

As a Senior Analyst, Workday Reporting you will be involved in reporting, projects and initiatives related to HR data, analytics, report design & creation, dashboards, data consolidation and scheduling of reports to optimize time savings for the team.  This involves requirement & stakeholder management, planning, and recommending the most effective way to produce and deliver reports, and provide data-driven insights to our business partners to support business objectives

 

The successful candidate for this role is a reporting and data analytics expert who understands the HR environment through Workday.  You have a passion to design best in class reporting – creating technical specifications, designing high-level queries, and conducting testing to ensure superior quality outputs.  Your ability to understand the Workday data sources through ETL empowers scale automation. Your proven experience building and maintaining relationships with business partners, capturing reporting requirements and managing change as new reports are introduced will enable success.   

 

Sound interesting? If you have what it takes, apply today! 

 

What will you do?

 

  • Design and develop and automate operational reports, analytical dashboards, or deliver ad-hoc findings based on business requirements through Workday.
  • Run, verify, and dispatch scheduled reports this may involve manual data extraction or making connections to available data sources on various platforms
  • Assist in setting up, administering and implementing our Workday Security framework
  • Conceptualize and understand field types and relationships between Workday business objects to develop analytics and new insights 
  • Identify opportunities to standardize and scale reports, fine-tune dashboards and curate insights
  • Provide production support to Managed Reporting Environment, launched dashboards and self-serve analytical tools to  business users, trouble shooting data discrepancies, execute and monitor scheduled processes to ensure deliverables are met
  • Participate in review of business requirements to determine the appropriate approach both from a technical and business perspective regarding Workday configurations to share where data is available and located

 

What do you need to succeed?

Must have

 

  • 3-5 years of Workday experience in custom report building from advanced reports to matrix reports to analyze real-time data
  • Ability to efficiently and effectively leverage Workday Business Objects and data sources to assess the report data you need or extract for business partners
  • Lead the Workday report scheduling distribution and delivery across HR
  • Ability to facilitate the Workday Security parameters for our various partners
  • Capability to enhance analytics by leveraging transposing, trending and composite reporting
  • Completed formal Workday training for Report Writer and Calculated Fields

 

Nice to have

 

  • Strong track record of data visualization using Tableau & MS Office suite of products (i.e. MS Access, Excel, Word, PowerPoint)
  • Advanced VBA - interfacing and connecting MS Office applications and data processing for reporting
  • Proficient with SQL and some exposure to set up, administration and use of relational database products such as Teradata, Postgres, MySQL, DB2, Oracle etc.
  • Experience with R and/or Python is an asset
  • Experience with or knowledge of Robotic Process Automation desirable
  • Knowledge of RBC organization and HR systems (e.g. HRIS, recruitment, learning)
  • Formal Workday or similar HRIS, SAP, SuccessFactors, Service Now training is an asset

 
What’s in it for you?


We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

 

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation, and stock where applicable.
  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities
  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact.
  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team.

  • Opportunities to take on progressively greater accountabilities.

item.title: Data Engineer
item.description:
What is the opportunity?

Wealth Management Applied Analytics and Innovation (WM AI) is responsible for developing and implementing a data and analytics strategy that delivers data reporting key insights to Senior Management, Advisors and associated functions across RBC Wealth Management. The team leverages deep experience in data engineering, programming, business strategy, data science, and visualization techniques to support its goal of empowering the organization with actionable insights to drive its ongoing success.

 

Within WM AI, the Data Science team is responsible for driving data reporting as well as advanced insight and innovation for the Wealth Management business by leveraging emergent big-data technologies, machine learning techniques, and data sources from across Wealth Management and RBC. 

This Data Engineering role is an opportunity to perform product development, programming, ETL and database work collaborating with Data Science, Data Reporting & Visualization, and Product Development functions within a small team using technologies including but not limited to SQL Server, AWS, Python, C#, SSIS, AWS, Windows, Linux, and the Apache Hadoop ecosystem. 

 

What will you do?

  • Design, develop, implement and support our emerging big data analytics capabilities through the development and maintenance of advanced data ingestion, processing, modeling and reporting capabilities.
  • Design and implement new or enhanced data processes or tools.
  • Ensure that your work is well-documented and developed in conjunction with other data engineers and the Data Visualization and Data Science teams.
  • Assist in current day-to-day support activities of Data Engineering, Data Visualization and Data Science teams, including generating reporting data sets for business users and senior management using Tableau, Excel, or other delivery methods.
  • Be a part of a start-up like setting where fast-fail is highly valued, level of uncertainty is high and requirements are not all defined in advance.

The work is for someone interested in computer science, data, application and ETL development.

 

What do you need to succeed?

 

Must have

  • Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or related quantitative discipline (e.g., Engineering, Physics, Mathematics, Statistics, Economics)
  • 3+ years’ experience in database design, data manipulation and/or a software engineering role using SQL Server or similar RDBMS environments, including stored procedures, views, and ETL processes (Extract, Transform, Load).
  • Experience developing complex SQL queries in order to generate data sets for our data science and data reporting & visualization teams.
  • Experience using cloud-enabled technologies such as Amazon Web Services (AWS), specifically S3, Athena, EMR, RDS, or other AWS database related products.
  • Drive to ensure data quality throughout all stages of acquisition and processing, including data sourcing/collection, normalization, and transformation.
  • Experience working with advanced SQL and at least one procedural/object-oriented programming language (Python, C, C#, Java, etc).

 

Nice-to-have

  • Experience with big data analytics technologies (e.g. Hadoop, Spark, Kafka); experience compiling, manipulating and assessing large datasets, with a good understanding of data processing frameworks. 
  • Experience developing SQL Server Integration Services.
  • Programming experience in Unix shell scripting.
  • Expertise in Microsoft Excel.

 

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

 

  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities
  • Opportunity to try new things, bring fresh ideas, innovation
  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact
  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team

item.title: Senior Manager, Data Scientist
item.description:
What is the opportunity?

The Senior Manager, Governance and Managment  supports  FDA and F&C leadership in assesing including providing Trending, Finance Analytics, Research, Executive/Operational Dashboards, and Expertise to senior management, enhancing their ability to cretae operational efficeincy across CFO.  The role ensures a robust and authoritative fact base and analytic capabilities to support of the execute and develop advance analytics within CFO. 

Additionally, the role provides ongoing feedback, advice, analysis and support, indepth data analysis, and higlight process gaps to executives and senior management, Functional Managers (FM) or Subject Matter Experts (SME) ensuring full benefit and clarity of Finance Analytics, the value proposition and overall positive impact on the RBC.

 

What will you do?

  • Extract, manipulate and analyze data from a variety of sources to formulate insightful conclusions, provide strategic recommendations, and inform management actions, both as part of routine people-level analytics and in support of new initiatives
  • Provide relevant, credible and actionable analytics to inform business diagnosis
  • Design complex and large-scale datasets to be used for statistical modeling and data mining
  • Conduct exploratory analysis and interpretation of new and different data sources to find solutions to business problems
  • Present and communicate data analysis in a clear and compelling way to business audiences, at all levels with the relevant insights
  • Design and implement scenario models relevant to Finance Domain
  • Perform tasks related to development of advanced data mining models which could include but not limited to clustering, segmentation, natural language processing, time-series analysis, sentiment analysis, linear programming, and Bayesian analysis.
  • Provide subject matter expertise in experimental design
  • Collaborate with internal stakeholders to develop tools and services such as modeling, dashboards, decision aids and business case analysis to drive innovation, strategic initiatives and recommend solutions
  • Work with internal technology groups to develop and enhance data support for model development and automation of the models
  • Support development of other team members immediate team and greater  team by involving them in key projects or initiatives; offers peer coaching and training/learning
  • Coordination with various groups for key inputs into models; Prepare detailed documentation to outline models and algorithms

 

What do you need to succeed?

Must-have

  • A degree in Machine Learning, Statistics, AI, Computer Science, Engineering, or Technology
  • Hadoop Developer or Data Scientist certification (Hortonworks preferred)
  • 3+ years of Applied Statistics, Data Mining, and Machine Learning experience
  • 5+ years of production experience with python, or equivalent statistical or ML framework
  • 3+ years of experience Unix/Linux shell scripting
  • Excellent understanding of the underlying Statistical, Machine Learning theory and Predictive Modeling Lifecycle
  • Production experience implementing Lookalike, Clustering Decision Tree models
  • Production experience with Text Mining, Natural language processing and Recommender systems
  • Expert-level SQL querying skills
  • In-depth understanding and production experience with the core Hadoop components, including Hive, Spark, HDFS etc.

 

Nice-to-have

  • Working knowledge of financial statements, forecasting, budgeting and financial analysis
  • Strong knowledge and skills of RBC data, analytics  methodology, practices and tools

 

    What’s in it for you?

    We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

    • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits
    • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities
    • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact
    • Work in an agile, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
    • The opportunity to interface with senior level executives from many different parts of the organization

     

     

     

    RBC is committed to supporting flexible work arrangements when and where available. Details to be discussed with Hiring Manager.

     

    RBC requires as a condition of employment that all successful candidates in the United States and Canada be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 prior to their start date, and may require proof of the same. Reasonable accommodation is available where required by law.

item.title: Audit Manager, Internal Audit US RBC AML/Compliance and Other Support Functions (HR and CAO)
item.description:
What is the opportunity?

  • Provide independent and objective evaluation of the adequacy and effectiveness of anti-money laundering (AML) and Compliance practices for all of the business lines within RBC in the US (i.e., US Capital Markets, US Wealth Management, Global Asset Management, WFC branch and the NY Credit Branch).
  • Support the US Director for IA US AML/Compliance and Other Support Functions with effective audit planning, reporting and issue remediation on all AML, Compliance and other support functions.
  • Able to work in a dynamically changing environment and act as a trusted advisor to the business.


What will you do?

Leadership & People Management:

  • Be part of a team of professional auditors responsible for audits with a focus on AML/Compliance and other support functions in the U.S.
  • Lead by example by collaborating with teams across IA to effectively plan and execute audits. 

Relationship Building and Client Experience:

  • Maintain effective working relationships with key stakeholders ensuring they get maximum value from engagement work.
  • Conduct periodic meetings with business to provide updates on audit results and status of open audit issue.
  • Coordinate and escalate regional issues to the Director for IA US AML/Compliance and Other Support Functions, Deputy US CAE, and US CAE in accordance with the IA escalation model.
  • Keep abreast of organizational, regulatory, product, strategic and financial changes and/or trends.

Audit and Assurance:

  • Contribute to audit planning that ensures adequate coverage of all areas of an audit to permit the issuance of an overall opinion on internal controls and risk management practices to senior management.
  • Participate in complex and confidential/special audit projects as requested by senior management of the Bank.
  • Ensure appropriate working paper evidence of findings is maintained and document all audit work with sufficient scope and accuracy.
  • Be able to work independently.

Data Analytics and Technology:

  • Work together with the Director for IA US AML/Compliance and Other Support Functions and Deputy US CAE to shift the capabilities of team members towards a predictive insights-driven organization.
  • Work together with the Director for IA US AML/Compliance and Other Support and Deputy US CAE to create networks and relationships with key stakeholders, to ensure their team is equipped with the right data, capabilities and tools for data analysis.

 

What do you need to succeed?

Relationship building and client experience:

  • Has recommended and helped to implement innovative solutions to improve inefficient processes
  • Solid relationship management skills

Audit and Assurance experience:

  • Solid knowledge of the US rules and regulations on AML
  • Regulatory/Compliance experience
  • Experience leading integrated business audits with technology auditors
  • ACAMS certification or studying towards ACAMS certification

Data Analytics & Technology experience:

  • Experienced in incorporating data analytics into the traditional audit programs and continuous auditing.

 

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation
  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities
  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact 
  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team 

 

 

RBC requires as a condition of employment that all successful candidates in the United States and Canada be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 prior to their start date, and may require proof of the same.  Reasonable accommodation is available where required by law.

item.title: Associate Director ORM (GCS)
item.description:
What is the opportunity?

This role supports operational risk management leadership within T&O including risk assessment, trending and analytics, reporting and expertise to senior management, enhancing their ability to anticipate and manage operational risks effectively in support of the execution of the T&O Operational Risk programs.  In this role you will lead operational risk reviews within Technology & Operations and provide expert feedback on the operational risk impact of major change initiatives, process improvements and transformational projects including event data collection, key risk indicators and risk & control identification and assessment. You will consult with executives and decision makers on the control environment of T&O’s methods, processes, frameworks and products to identify gaps and control enhancements.

.

 

What will you do? 

  • Develop, source and monitor key risk and controls indicators and provide analysis to identify systemic issues for assessment of action plans
  • Lead detailed Operational and IT risk and control assessments to identify, measure and analyze key operational risks and provide mitigation strategies where appropriate
  • Monitor and report on the T&O Operational risk profile to senior leadership
  • Perform in-depth data analytics to deliver enhanced insights to inform the risk profile
  • Work closely with the T&O Operational Risk Management leaders and teams and RBC Group Risk Management to ensure RBC Operational Risk Management standards and requirements are met
  • Provides operational risk expertise where needed to improve risk based decision-making
  • Work directly with 1st and 2nd line in the review of internal operational risk events to understand root causes, process deficiencies and control failures
  • Lead assessment and analysis work as required on transformational program/projects
  • Participate in the investigation and analysis of external loss events/incidents to assess potential systemic weaknesses and ensures appropriate corrective action
  • Responsible for providing guidance and support leadership with respect to managing risks and executing on operational risk programs

 
What do you need to succeed?
 
Must-have 

  • University degree or equivalent
  • 10+ years in a combination of knowledge, skill and background in leading operational and IT risk management practices
  • Strong cyber and technical knowledge (including application development, IT infrastructure, cloud and emerging technology, cybersecurity)
  • Strong problem solving, analytical (including qualitative analysis), research and quantitative skills
  • Strong presentation and communication (verbal and written) skills
  • Strong stakeholder management skills including experience interacting with executive leaders
  • Proven ability to impact and influencing skills
  • Excellent knowledge of T&O’s methods, products, processes and organization
  • Self-organized with proven time management skills

 

Nice-to-have

  • Professional risk and/ or technology designations (CRM, CRISC, CISSP, PRMIA/other risk management)
  • Strong knowledge of RBC’s organization, processes and compliance
  • Working knowledge of industry Governance, Risk and Compliance (GRC) solutions/packages (e.g., Archer)

item.title: Data Analyst
item.description:
What is the Opportunity?

 

Please note this role is available nationally.

The Process Automation & Data Analytics (PANDA) team supports RBC Bank Operations and overall RBC Bank strategy by delivering its mandate on three pillars: Process Excellence, Process Automation and Data Analytics.

The team is further building its Data Analytics pillar and is hiring a Data Analyst who would be responsible for providing modeling, data, reporting and analysis for the team.  This role requires a broad technical skill set ranging from database technologies, to open source scripting languages, to reporting platforms. You will be working with our subject matter experts and other internal stakeholders to analyze, recommend, design, and deliver high-quality reporting solutions or automating a certain manual task by leveraging data visualization (e.g. Tableau) or creating exception reports (e.g. SQL queries).  You would be conducting interviews with subject matter experts to understand the problem statement, designing/developing solutions and testing/implementing them.

 

What Will You Do?

  • Leverage SQL, Tableau and other analytic platforms to gather, clean and prepare data; develop key performance indicators; create dashboards/reports; and analyze trends to understand their analytical needs and deliver insights that drive results.
  • Leverage available technologies and critical thinking skills to continually drive innovation and automation into our existing methodologies, processes and reporting.
  • Integrate new tools and software to streamline processes and improve efficiency, working methods, and culture within the team.
  • Test and validate new and existing reports and analytics for adherence to business and technical requirements
  • Create and maintain accurate documentation related to reporting solutions, including specifications, data lineage, technical and business definitions for metrics, and test plan/test cases
  • Interface with internal clients to gain insights on how information is consumed by the audience, and then determine efficient ways to present and deliver such information.
  • Provide basic production support for Blue Prism Robotic Process Automation environment where required.

 

What do you need to succeed?

Must-have

  • Advanced proficiency in developing reports using Tableau
  • Nimble with SQL for querying and joining large datasets and/or creating reports (e.g. MSSQL, Teradata, HDFS)
  • Ability to perform complex data analysis on large volumes of data and present findings to senior leadership in order to inform strategic decisions
  • Proven innovative mindset with quantitative analytical and problem solving skills
  • Expert technical documentation skills and the ability to effectively communicate, verbally and in writing, technical concepts to a non-technical audience
  • Comfortable dealing with ambiguity and working independently
  • A team player who is passionate about developing peers, winning as a team, and providing constructive feedback when needed
  • Curiosity to learn the business and new technologies as well as flexible to pivot focus to support the team where required

Nice-to-have

  • University degree in a quantitative field of study (e.g., engineering, computer science, etc.)
  • Financial Services Industry experience
  • Familiarity with Banking Controls Environment
  • Experience with technologies such as GitHub, Jira, general APIs
  • Project management capabilities

                                                                                                         

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation, commissions, and stock where applicable
  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities
  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact
  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
  • Be a part of a highly capable team of professionals who regularly partner together and work collaboratively to solve complex problems
  • Flexible work/life balance options
  • Opportunities to do challenging work
  • Opportunities to take on progressively greater accountabilities 

 

RBCBank

 

 

About RBC
Royal Bank of Canada is Canada’s largest bank, and one of the largest banks in the world, based on market capitalization. We are one of North America’s leading diversified financial services companies, and provide personal and commercial banking, wealth management, insurance, investor services and capital markets products and services on a global basis. We employ approximately 78,000 full- and part-time employees who serve more than 16 million personal, business, public sector and institutional clients through offices in Canada, the U.S. and 39 other countries. For more information, please visit rbc.com.

 

Inclusion and Equal Opportunity Employment
RBC is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion. We are pleased to consider all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, protected veterans status, Aboriginal/Native American status or any other legally-protected factors. Disability-related accommodations during the application process are available upon request.

item.title: Product Owner, Data Fabric
item.description:
What is the opportunity?

 

The DNA (Data & Analytics) group is responsible for enabling and implementing RBC’s Data Vision. We build data-driven services and platforms aimed to serve our clients better.  This opportunity is to be the Product Owner to help create and deliver the transformation of our data platforms and introduce new operational processes with a focus on enabling the enterprise data fabric.  In this role, you will help to shape and execute the data-platform product strategy to meet our strategic goals of leveraging data and AI to deliver to the business consumers.

 

What will you do?

 

  • Clearly define and document “what” needs to be built and develop the product/service roadmap, including identifying the prioritized feature set and dependencies.
  • Working directly with stakeholders, business partners, other product owners to understand business strategies and use cases (requirements), ensuring product features and roadmap are aligned to business needs, and delivering business value
  • Accountability for feature development and roadmap prioritization to enable product delivery.  Capture use cases and features for development as well as provide execution and integration support between Engineering / Operations and consuming teams transitioning to the data-fabric capabilities. 
  • Translate between business and technical delivery teams to ensure understanding and alignment through documentation, communication, and interpretation 
  • Execute through Agile processes (Sprint planning, Sprint Retro, Backlog refinement, Sprint Review), and ensure Jira/Confluence is up to date
  • Ensure stakeholder awareness and alignment by providing updates and developing materials and metrics for key meetings, demos, and presentations on progress and enabled value.
  • Support the continuous improvement of the product management practice by evolving and introducing best practices, templates, and new ways of working

 

What do you need to succeed?

Must-have

 

  • Proven track record of successful product-oriented development and delivery
  • Experience and track record of success directing the efforts of development as a project manager or product owner in a deadline-driven and fast-paced environment
  • Demonstrated ability in written and oral communication skills along with strong presentation skills. Ability to determine the information and communication needs of the stakeholders and project.
  • Strong prioritization skills
  • Strong collaboration skills
  • A strong understanding of the technology and/or financial services industry
  • Strong learning ability to adopt new technologies and methodologies with a growth mindset
  • Experience working in a large corporate environment
  • Undergrad degree

 

Nice-to-have

 

  • Expertise/ understanding of data-platform, software, analytics, business intelligence technology
  • Expertise/ understanding of advanced analytics, data mining analytical models/ data science
  • PMP and CSM
  • Experience working with Agile software development
