item.title: Product Analyst
item.description:
Product Analyst

 

What is the opportunity?

 

The DNA (Data & Analytics) group is responsible for enabling and implementing RBC’s Data Vision across all platforms. We build data-driven services and platforms aimed to serve our clients better. This opportunity is for a Product Analyst role on the Enterprise Client product. The role is reporting to the Director Product Analysis and Quality and is responsible for execution of all aspects of requirements delivery, elicitation, analysis, documentation, and reporting needs. 

 

 

What will you do?

 

  • Business analysis including stakeholder analysis to identify impacted groups and facilitate requirements discovery, analysis and review, management of risks,  interdependencies, assumptions and constraints for requirements
  • Data analysis into the data warehouse and other data sources to better understand (to uncover) possible join issues, data resolution issues, and missing data prior to serving productionalized data to consumers
  • Partner with the Product and Business Architects, and Technology teams to communicate business needs and explore, assess and recommend value-add solution options to support business strategies
  • Collaborate with Product team and stakeholders to ensure effective delivery of product features
  • Work with Product team to provide updates and supporting materials for key meetings, presentations on progress, and support the completion of monthly Business Review Document (BRD) and  Privacy/Governance/Risk documents
  • Participate in effort estimation at product level (distill requirements so that the tech teams can easily understand)
  • Work with Quality engineering team to support testing to ensure quality of  deliverables
  • Support execution of Agile processes (Sprint planning, Sprint Retro, Backlog refinement, Sprint Review), and ensure Jira/ Confluence are up to date.

 

 

What do you need to succeed?

 

Must-have

  • 3+ years of experience working in the areas of requirements management and data (Financial Services Industry preferred)
  • Experience in requirements planning and prioritization including stakeholder analysis and effort estimation
  • Strong analytical thinking skills
  • Strong communication skills- written and verbal
  • Strong collaboration skills
  • Relevant Undergrad degree

 

 

Nice-to-have

  • Experience with data transformation initiatives
  • Experience working in a large corporate environment
  • Familiarity with SDLC, platform, software, analytics, business intelligence technology, agile methodology
  • Good at writing SQL queries

 

 

RBC requires as a condition of employment that all successful candidates in the United States and Canada be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 prior to their start date, and may require proof of the same. Reasonable accommodation is available where required by law.

item.title: Data Engineer
item.description:
What is the opportunity?
The Data Engineering team in RBC Investor & Treasury Services (I&TS) plays a critical role to implement Data strategy.  The team supports data architecture processes including gap analysis and enterprise data modeling, centralizes heterogeneous data sources, builds automated data pipelines, custom APIs and assist with building the analytical models. We are looking for an experienced data engineer who is quick to adapt to next generation technologies and enthusiastic about analyzing and automating data and building solid products and solutions
 

As a Full Stack Developer/Data Engineer, you will design and develop solutions across multiple data sources across various geographies.  You will encompass an end to end delivery of Data services as per Software Delivery lifecycle.
 

What you will you do?

  • Design, development and deployment of real-time data pipelines (inbound, outbound and Data services/APIs through container-based solutions as per Software delivery life cycle
  • Collaborate with data scientists, process engineers and business stakeholders to develop data pipelines, and assist with prescriptive and predictive analytics through consolidated data
  • Work with platform and infrastructure groups to configure and stand-up required hardware and software stacks.
     

What do you need to succeed?
Must Have:

  • 3+ years of hands-on experience in following key technologies:
  • Full stack development:  Python, Node.JS, Angular, MSSQL server
  • Automation/DevOps: Jenkins, Selenium and similar technologies
  • Cloud technologies: Openshift, PCF
  • Source code control: GIT
  • Experience working in agile/SaFe environment
  • Strong knowledge of algorithms and data structures.
  • Comfortable applying engineering best practices for Test Driven Development, integration testing, version control, Continuous Integration

Nice to Have:

  • Master’s degree in Computer science or equivalent experience
  • Hands on experience with Data modeling and data architecture
  • Security frameworks: LDAP, Kerberos, OAuth 2.0, Vault integration
  • DevOps: Nexus, UCD

 

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual. 

  • Interaction with a wide variety of departments within Investor & Treasury Services
  • The opportunity to work on projects relating to bank-wide data initiatives
  • Work collaboratively with business partners, IT, and Data Management in order to deliver new capabilities effectively
  • Stay close to industry best practices in account, client data, and KYC management
  • Apply interpersonal and influencing skills to develop strong relationships with the Data Management team, Data Management IT, stakeholders across RBC I&TS, and individuals participating in the various data project streams
  • Communicate effectively with RBC I&TS professionals at varying levels of seniority, including applying insight to determine the business impact of data issues that may arise in the availability, integrity, or completeness of data which can be supported through better governance

RBC is committed to supporting flexible work arrangements when and where available. Details to be discussed with Hiring Manager.

 

RBC requires as a condition of employment that all successful candidates in the United States and Canada be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 prior to their start date, and may require proof of the same.  Reasonable accommodation is available where required by law.

As a BI Platform Engineer you will be responsible to help build out the BI Technologies platforms (Oracle BI, Tableau, Datameer, Dataiku, SAS, ThoughtSpot, MS Reporting Services, etc.) for the Enterprise. The role will put BI platforms in place meeting high performance, scaling to large user volumes, and high volume concurrency. The successful candidate will work with senior management to influence and impact across the enterprise in promoting the BI and Analytics strategic direction across the enterprise. Develop and support the use of the BI Centre of Excellence policies, tools, and best practices across the enterprise.

 

What will you do?

item.title: Data Architect
item.description:
What is the opportunity?

  • The DNA (Data & Analytics) group is responsible for enabling and implementing RBC’s Data Vision. We build data-driven services and platforms aimed to serve our vision of making every single client interaction informed by A.I. within the next three years. We work with petabytes of data. Above all, our work has a direct impact in the way we interact with our consumers.
  • Currently, we are looking for a Data Architect with an expertise in RBC Data Domains & Semantic Automations to build & support Semantic layers on RBC Heterogeneous (Analytical & LOBs) eco-systems to develop, extend and promote the Enterprise Data Strategy adoption via Data Mesh/Fabric. Also enable Data Understanding, Consistent Views over Trusted Data sources – benefiting Data Scientists, AI/ML Models, Insights & BI Analysts or any Data Practitioner.

 

What will you do?

  • Automation, extend and promote the RBC Data Domains & Semantic layer deployments. Create strategies, standards, and guidelines; exercise influence and impact across the enterprise.
  • Interface with systems and business management to raise their level of data understanding on data domains, models & schemas and provision DNA product usages.
  • Collaborate with Business partners, LOB & Operational teams, CDO/DMO/… for data domains and modelling, architectural strategies; liaise with teams for planning and implementation
  • Deliver CDO aligned data domain models to standup and fully operationalize, offering consistent & standardized data views across organization adhering to data principles, architecture & modeling guidelines, design standards and industry best practices.
  • Promote the goals of data domains, data reuse, data integration, data stewardship, data quality and governance.
  • Integrate vendor products and RBC internal systems to provide seamless user experience.
  • Evaluate new technologies/products and perform PoC/PoT.

 

 What do you need to succeed?     

Must-have

  • Knowledge on various RBC Domains & Lines of Business as must (for ex – Client Domain for P&CB and other LOBs)
  • Good understanding on Data Fabric/Mesh concepts, Semantic Layers.
  • Assist in automation of Schema building and logistics as must (using Kafka, Scripting, Java or Python or similar).
  • Solid understanding of the Financial Industry including: Personal and Business banking; AML and Fraud; Risk Management; Trading Systems and Portfolio management ; Insurance.
  • Governance, Audit Controls, Policies & Standard Mgmt on Data Warehouse, Enterprise Lake, (Snowflake - nice to have)
  • Metadata Mgmt, Data Catalog, Data Modelling & Architecture as must.
  • Expert knowledge of Dimensional Modelling concepts and application utilizing best practices.
  • Working knowledge on Data Acquisition, Data Storage & Computational patterns with industry standard BI & data analytics needs.
  • Data Security & Protection for On-Prem & Cloud capabilities.
  • Works in proximity with Data Analysts & Business SMT.
  • Strong communication skills with ability to work cross-functionally to articulate, measure and solve issues.
  • University degree in Computer Science, Engineering or Mathematics.

 

Nice-to-have

  • Experience in working on a large scale data warehousing Teradata environment, HDFS data lake & nice to have knowhow on cloud lake house eco-systems such as Snowflake.
  • Experience leveraging big data technologies (Hadoop and related technologies) to build data products and services.
  • Knowledge of identity access management and security best practices.

item.title: Director, Data Mesh Architecture
item.description:
WHAT IS THE OPPORTUNITY?

 

The Enterprise Data Architecture team is undertaking multiple complex enterprise-wide initiatives as part of RBC’s ongoing plan to improve technology management and architectural governance across the organization. 

In this role you will be responsible for strategically driving the adoption of Data Mesh, socializing a product mindset to build domain-oriented data assets, developing architectures that enable domain self-service, and building alignment with various solution architecture teams to realize the key objectives of the Enterprise Data Architecture strategy.

The role is focused on defining and establishing the data architecture for several key areas like Data Mesh, Data fabric, hybrid/Multi-cloud Analytic repositories, Machine Learning, and Insights, as well as supporting Data Management and DataOps capabilities. You will be required to address Data, Integration, and Security concerns across Public Cloud, On-Premise, and SaaS solutions and work across various functional teams (InfoSec, App Dev, Infrastructure, Cloud, and Integration) to drive architecture decisions.

 

This includes planning, evaluating, recommending, and designing architectural solutions in compliance with enterprise standards and coordinating among distributed architecture and technology teams to facilitate the delivery of enterprise capabilities. This role is expected to establish them as competent and respected Technology professionals amongst their peers and partners.  

 

WHAT WILL YOU DO?

 

  • Realize the vision for the Enterprise Data Mesh and adoption of hybrid/Multi-cloud data repositories, while rationalizing and pivoting major programs to deliver value faster
  • Conceptualize and influence solutions to major programs that steer toward desirable outcomes, in alignment with the Enterprise Data Architecture Strategy.
  • Work with CDO/DMO to define and operationalize the Data Mesh Domains
  • Drive automation and quality of data products with DevOps best practices for Data
  • Be grounded on Software and system engineering design principles for data and integration architecture, security, automation, orchestration and Data Observability Engineering
  • Enable the foundation of self-service infrastructure – Cloud-based Data Lakehouse, Data Fabric, and Event Data Streaming etc.
  • Demonstrate breadth in established and emerging data disciplines: In addition to depth in established data management capabilities, the incumbent should be experienced in emerging technologies and paradigms in the Data and Analytics space
  • Conceive and portray the big picture for Data integration Solutions, with the perspective for delivering Enterprise value, and can analyze the current state and conceptualize desired future state, and define initiatives needed to close the gap between current and future state goals.
  • Ability to astutely operate in the organization: Key characteristics which point to the data architect’s ability to operate efficiently in the organization are (1) influential – Be and be known as an expert, (2) able to emphasize methodology, and architecture principles while decision making and (3) be articulate, persuasive, and collaborative.

 

WHAT DO YOU NEED TO SUCCEED?

 Must have:

  • University or post-graduate degree; the ideal candidate will have a strong academic background (e.g., computer science, engineering), coupled with 15+ years of expertise leading architecture teams. Cloud certification is an asset.
  • Proven experience in implementing at least one of the Data mesh Topologies at other FIs – Governed mesh, Harmonized mesh, or Federated mesh
  • Demonstrated ability in written and oral communication skills along with strong presentation skills. Ability to determine the information and communication needs of the stakeholders and project.
  • A practitioner of both Enterprise Data Architecture and Solution Architecture with a record of both program and delivery outcomes based on their architectures.
  •  Deadline-driven and results-oriented; able to meet consistently high-quality standards while handling a variety of tasks and deadlines simultaneously.
  • Working experience with multiple data storage and analysis toolsets—including current distributed technologies: Snowflake/Redshift/Azure Synapse, Databricks Delta, Starburst Trino, Kafka, or similar data architectures.
  • Experience in building data streaming solutions using Apache Spark (both batch and streaming) and similar cloud-native architectures
  • Experience in handling architectural and design considerations such as performance, scalability, reusability, and flexibility issues
  • Envision and expertly express the benefits and constraints of technology solutions to technology partners, business partners, and team members
  • Solid grasp of using cloud-native solutions and Data Security on Cloud-based applications
  • Must have expertise in Data Analytics and Integration architecture and working knowledge of other domains and technology including Cloud, Containers, API, Events, Security, Integration, Infrastructure, and AI.

 

Nice-to-have:

  • Experience in a matrix environment, such as a large, publicly-traded corporation
  • Lean Six Sigma or equivalent to drive continuous lean operations
  • Have led or been part of an Enterprise Data Architecture Function
  • Experience researching emerging technology and providing Points of View or whitepapers

 

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation, commissions, and stock where applicable
  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities

  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
  • A world-class training program in financial services
  • Flexible work/life balance options
  • Opportunities to do challenging work

item.title: Sr. Data Architect, Data Automation(Calgary, AB)
item.description:
WHAT IS THE OPPORTUNITY?  

 

The Enterprise Data Architecture team is undertaking multiple complex enterprise-wide initiatives as part of RBC’s ongoing plan to improve technology management and architectural governance across the organization. In this role you will be responsible for embedding Data Policies and standards into the platform, and products.   
The role is focused on enabling a data governance operating model embedded as automation or policies as code.  The incumbent will need to work with engineering, security, product architecture, and data architecture, for rollout of capabilities on both private and public cloud.  You will be required to address Data, Integration and Security concerns across Public Cloud, On-Premise and SaaS solutions and work across various functional teams (Info Sec, App Dev, Infrastructure, Cloud and Integration) to drive architecture decisions. 
This includes planning, evaluating, recommending and designing architectural solutions in compliance with enterprise standards and coordinate among distributed architecture and technology teams to facilitate delivery of enterprise capabilities. This role is expected to establish themselves as a competent and respected Technology professional amongst their peers and partners.  


WHAT WILL YOU DO? 

 

•    This role would need broad skillset, public private cloud infrastructure, knowledge of data governance, standards, polices, both internal to RBC and external (regulatory, etc.), data reference architecture, while demonstrating proficiency in engineering.
•    Implement and deliver ‘Policy as code’ would also need to be verifiable. The data policy can be a management, control or quality policy that requires automated tests and monitoring for gaps in implementation of polices.
•    Drive automation and quality of data products with DevOps best practices for Data 
•    Be grounded on Software and system engineering design principles for data and integration architecture, security, automation, orchestration and Data Observability Engineering
•    Demonstrate breadth in established and emerging data disciplines: In addition to depth in established data management capabilities, the incumbent should be experienced in emerging technologies and paradigms in the Data and Analytics space
